intro: Oxypetalum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers warm and moist conditions.
